camel.source.path.method.name: camel.source.path.method
camel.source.path.method.description: HTTP method to use. One of: [get] [post] [put] [delete] [patch] [head] [trace] [connect] [options]

camel.source.endpoint.consumes.name: camel.source.endpoint.consumes
camel.source.endpoint.consumes.description: Media type such as: 'text/xml', or 'application/json' this REST service accepts. By default we accept all kinds of types.

camel.source.endpoint.inType.name: camel.source.endpoint.inType
camel.source.endpoint.inType.description: To declare the incoming POJO binding type as a FQN class name

camel.source.endpoint.outType.name: camel.source.endpoint.outType
camel.source.endpoint.outType.description: To declare the outgoing POJO binding type as a FQN class name

camel.source.endpoint.produces.name: camel.source.endpoint.produces
camel.source.endpoint.produces.description: Media type such as: 'text/xml', or 'application/json' this REST service returns.

camel.source.endpoint.routeId.name: camel.source.endpoint.routeId
camel.source.endpoint.routeId.description: Name of the route this REST services creates

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.consumerComponentN.name: camel.source.endpoint.consumerComponentName
camel.source.endpoint.consumerComponentN.description: The Camel Rest component to use for (consumer) the REST transport, such as jetty, servlet, undertow. If no component has been explicit configured, then Camel will lookup if there is a Camel component that integrates with the Rest DSL, or if a org.apache.camel.spi.RestConsumerFactory is registered in the registry. If either one is found, then that is being used.

camel.source.endpoint.description.name: camel.source.endpoint.description
camel.source.endpoint.description.description: Human description to document this REST service

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.name: camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.rest.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.component.rest.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.rest.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.rest.consumerComponentNa.name: camel.component.rest.consumerComponentName
camel.component.rest.consumerComponentNa.description: The Camel Rest component to use for (consumer) the REST transport, such as jetty, servlet, undertow. If no component has been explicit configured, then Camel will lookup if there is a Camel component that integrates with the Rest DSL, or if a org.apache.camel.spi.RestConsumerFactory is registered in the registry. If either one is found, then that is being used.

camel.component.rest.basicPropertyBindin.name: camel.component.rest.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.rest.basicPropertyBindin.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities
